title: Keen story - The Future of Earth; parts 1 & 2
content:
By the way, to whom do you submit Keen stories nowadays? I read on CC314 news that Flaose had wiped out his email, and didn't quite know where to put it.

In either case, I finally got into the mood and finished part 1 of the story. Feedback and spotted errors for when I finally submit it appreciated.

(Parts 1 and 2 now up. Anyone up for hosting 2? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] )

Part 1:

[url=http://arnott.f2s.com/files/keenearthfuture.pdf]From grafix's server (thank you [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [/url]

Part 2:

[url=http://arnott.f2s.com/files/keenearthfuture2.pdf]Grafix's server again [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] Thank yous![/url]

This project has been some two years in the making (see if you can spot the transition between what I wrote two years ago and started now!). I'm only showing it now that I know I'll finish it. I'm on a writing spree, I'm nearly done with part 2, and even the parts seem to be getting shorter as I grow older and learn terseness. Again, comments much appreciated [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Edit: debunk yousendit links removed.[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote]

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
How about only people who will host it somewhere else should download it (grafix, xtra?)
Everyone else can get it from there.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
Here ya go: [url=http://arnott.f2s.com/files/keenearthfuture.pdf]The Future of Earth[/url] by KeenEmpire.

It was a long time since Flaose left, wasn't it? (two years, IIRK) Wonder if he'll remember us when he gets back in a year's time...
[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url] | 2 pence an hour for godawful tech support job... [url=http://www.jobsite.co.uk/cgi-bin/vacdetails.pl?selection=915675807]yes please![/url]

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
Why, thank you! He said he was coming back in a year? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-celtic.gif[/img] I miss him already.[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote]

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
Eh, I think Flaose meant he'll never return the forums again. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] I may be wrong, though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] Hopefully I misunderstood him.

As for the story, it's excellent! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] Is English your native language? I really can't tell. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
Thank you. Hm, I'm not quite sure what you mean by that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stoned.gif[/img] But to answer, English is my native language de facto, not de jure.

Part II and editing is basically done. I'm just awaiting feedback from certain people before I post it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote]

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
Quite an interesting [and by comparision to the chapter-by-chapter fanfics here, quite long] piece of fanfiction; it seems to take the tradditional fanfic approach and applies it to Keen; I'm interested; have you done much fanfics befre? What did you model this story on, I've seen several following roughly the same theme [magic vs tech hero picks a side] in sonic fanfiction, and twice at the JCF.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
KeenEmpire wrote the M-Files, Lords of Magic and a few other Keen fictions (all of which can be found a [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]CC314[/url]'s Fanfic section). I haven't had a chance to read much of The Future of Earth, but I have noticed it includes some characters from the M-Files.

It's good to see you writing Keen fic again, KeenEmpire - I enjoyed reading your other Keen stories.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen story - The Future of Earth (prelim title) part 1
content:
Part II is out! The yousendit link can be found here:

[url=http://s41.yousendit.com/d.aspx?id=1X240378H6EIR35WPCGBBLWW5P]s41.yousendit.com/d.aspx?id=1X240378H6EIR35WPCGBBLWW5P[/url]

Anyone up to hosting it, again? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

LL, I've only written Keen fanfic, and haven't done any for a while, either. I'm not quite sure what you mean by a traditional fanfic approach, but I didn't really use a model; I just started with the premise of a victorious homeworld and went on from there. (And I didn't know they had magic in the Star Wars universe o.O)

Spike, thanks [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Edit: bad link[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote]
